website_summaries.verdict: A restrictive polyester lanyard with good build quality.
pros: Made with snap hooks and heavy-duty polyester, this lanyard can reduce the impact of a fall
It is six feet in length
cons: The clips have been known to jam

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a good quality unit.  Thx
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and seems to be exactly what it is supposed to be. I haven’t fallen and I’m not planning on doing so to see if this works But if I do fall and they don’t work, my wife will up date the review for me. She’ll also be single again and looking for a new husband.
customer_reviews.author: Gary T.

customer_reviews.title: Will save your life
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a harness for some at home roof repairs. This thing is heavy duty and is sewn such that if I were to take a fall, there is redundancy in the fabric so it would lessen the force as my fall was broken. I thankfully haven't had a chance to "test" it out, but the build quality is superb. A Must for anyone working at heights. The hooks themselves are secure, but easy to clip onto surfaces/harness. They have a simple design, which is great if you are working with thick gloves, or like to minimize the time you are not clipped into an anchor point.
customer_reviews.author: GJ

customer_reviews.title: The bucket is a great idea!!! The harnass was easy to use and made me feel safe!
customer_reviews.text: When I was looking for a harness, I asked around a bit at work and a few people mentioned Guardian's bucket. What a great idea. I used the harness and the rope to get me safety secured on the roof and then used the bucket to hoist my tools up. Then when I was done, packed it all back away in the bucket with top. This way, it should all be there next time I need it. If it was stored separate, I would probably misplace something. Just a great idea!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Zajicek

customer_reviews.title: This is a great positional lanyard for the money
customer_reviews.text: I really like the stuffiness and weight of this lanyard. It was never too heavy to handle. Only complaint is it may be too long for shorter people 5'9" like me. It would swing into my footpath and almost trip me. This is a positional lanyard as well which is not meant to be used while moving along larger pipe grids. Get a double lanyard with wider hooks to be able to hook on to anything while moving.
customer_reviews.author: EnriqueU

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 3-sided tower safety.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fall arrest device for saving your life. The dual lanyards allow you to remain 100% connected as you climb. You move one side at a time as you ascend/descend. It is not a shock cord nor bungee cord. Do not try to "straighten out" the wrinkles. Do not try to "test" it or hang from it, as this it a 1-fall device that cannot be reset. This connects to a harness, not a climbing belt. This is one part of a layer of safety devices providing Personal Fall Arrest. Inspect before use. Use properly. This appears a bit heavy, however, as you climb- the weight of the rebar hooks are on the tower.
customer_reviews.author: NW2M - Rockville MD

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and sturdy.. Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bunch of safety equipment online and this lanyard was one of the purchases. Buying something like this on the internet is sketchy for me because you can't tell the level of quality, but after receiving the product I can tell you it is very well made. Strong, zinc plated smooth operating metal rings, wrapped sling material so it doesn't damage the actual safety cord. I am not sure how to make a long review of such a simple product except to say I was very pleased at the quality and I think you will be too. Thank you for your time.
customer_reviews.author: Henry G.

customer_reviews.title: May save you!
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it will work. Would rather have a giant bungie cord, but this is what I have. The strap is sewn together in little sections that will rip apart as you fall and that is supposed to soften the jolt. Hope to never fall out.
customer_reviews.author: James Garrett

customer_reviews.title: so good. I haven't fallen
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I haven't fallen, and don't plan to.
customer_reviews.author: TCB

customer_reviews.title: Economical but good product. Shock-absorbing 6ft fall arrest lanyard with good ...
customer_reviews.text: Economical but good product. Shock-absorbing 6ft fall arrest lanyard with good self-closing anti-rollout connectors. Recommend using a "Rolo" for worker positioning. Don't write on fall protection equipment as inks can damage materials.
customer_reviews.author: Torqwrench

customer_reviews.title: Great price and complies with OSHA
customer_reviews.text: Use for tying off when cleaning the chimney. This one had the best price I could find. Haven't really tested it yet as I haven't fallen down the roof.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Fall Protection Lanyard
customer_reviews.text: It works! I hope I never have to report that it worked to save my life, so all I have to say is that it appears to be good quality and the locking hooks work smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Angela K.

customer_reviews.title: These will hold weight well
customer_reviews.text: Nice wide ring clamp has a wide opening for easy attachment and removal as you climb. Shock cord should help ease the fall tug a bit if you slip and fall.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Evans

customer_reviews.title: Better than falling off a roof and landing on your head ...
customer_reviews.text: After taking a bad fall off a roof in december , it was about time to get a proper safety system. So i got the guardian harness and lanyard.. It is top notch . Its padded in all the right places , its comftorable , and safe.. Thanks for a good product...
customer_reviews.author: David H Menke

customer_reviews.title: Nice and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Annoyed that the thread on the fall indicator tag came loose so it looks like I fell. Luckily the jobs that I normally work aren't too strict. Some places will make you throw it away once the fall indicators come undone. Other than that they work great and are light weight. Not nearly as bulky as the the one with the shock pack, and you don't have it bouncing off your back all day.
customer_reviews.author: Rush

customer_reviews.title: Haven’t “used it” yet but it is quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and value. This definitely gives me a sense of trust and protection up in my bucket truck.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I like the big hooks but the lanyard itself didn't retract like I thought it would. And the hooks are also a little heavy would recommend the aluminum hooks to anyone else. But wouldn't trust anything else to save my life if fall!
customer_reviews.author: aaron stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for 2 months now and is very nice to have
customer_reviews.author: Yesman!

customer_reviews.title: Clips jam on either end, otherwise it's a good fall protector
customer_reviews.text: This does the job, but after only one week's use the clips take five minutes to get open! Am going to try some WD-40 on them as this is ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: L. C. Bone

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Safe and sturdy. We use it on our roofing jobs all of the time.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad,but...
customer_reviews.text: Used once after receiving, the hook space is not enough .

customer_reviews.title: Good quality the best of the best materials
customer_reviews.text: It's worth every penny it's strong good quality professional grade it's the real deal for safety durability and peace of mind the hooks are strong and obviously the quality is the best of the best
customer_reviews.author: prelude22

customer_reviews.title: Be mindful of load indicator
customer_reviews.text: The ladder hooks springs are weak only lasted a year or so. Load indicator deployed even though no fall was taken.

customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with product, Amazon grouped it with marine applications. It is an industrial fall Protection device not suitable for a marine safety device. I blame my disappointment/error on Amazon not the provider

customer_reviews.title: Hight Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a life line for my deer stand and I am not disappointed. Hopefully I will not have to ever find out if it works but with the quality of the materials I am confident that this will save my life.

customer_reviews.text: This is a great product...hope I never have to use it....but I'm impressed with the quality. And I like the fact they are 6 feet....reduces chokers for extension.

customer_reviews.title: Glad he was there and another lanyard was available
customer_reviews.text: I was 122 feet in the air when the return spring on the rebar hook clasp broke. Very light use. Ground man had to climb up with another lanyard for me to get down. Glad he was there and another lanyard was available. All of our Guardian products are in the trash. Can not trust.
customer_reviews.author: john page

customer_reviews.title: I like this lanyard
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality I would recommend this to any co worker. Mine didn't come with the green color on the hooks but glad. Didn't want that color in my work attire anyway.

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure it's fine for non-marine applications
customer_reviews.text: I had to return it. The shackles do not match the picture; they do not even match the picture on the packaging. Perhaps at some point they made a switch, but that decision by the manufacturer has rendered these unsuitable for marine applications. The description reads "lightweight." They are not. They are VERY heavy shackles, difficult to release and will rust in a single season. I'm sure it's fine for non-marine applications.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Hetzer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality well made just what I needed and expected

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: We are restricted to 100% tie-off on all climbs above 6 feet. With these twin rebar hooks I can climb non-compliant towers without the fatigue of manipulating carabiners all the way up.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: You got to have the lanyard when you own the full safety body harness. Unless you are willing to spend big bucks for the retractable lanyard, this harness will meet the safety requirements to help keep you safe when working in elevated areas. This is a great buy for the price.

product_meta.title: Guardian Fall Protection 11200 IS-72 6-Foot Internal Shock Lanyard with snap hooks
product_meta.description:
Size:6 ft| Style:Single Leg/Steel Snap HookMade with heavy duty outer polyester webbing and a polyester core specifically sewn in to reduce impact forces; does not stretch and has No shock pack; Lightweight.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Guardian Fall Protection "Internal Shock Lanyard" is made with heavy duty outer polyester webbing and a polyester core specifically sewn in to reduce impact forces. This lanyard does not stretch and has no shock pack, so it is lightweight as well.
feature_bullets: Made with a heavy duty outer polyester webbing and a polyester core specially sewn in to reduce impact forces

specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
